p: Within the targeted dataset, samples varied from 14 to 20 in the number of the 20 compounds analyzed, strongly differed between species (ANOVA; df = 3, F-value = 29.95, P-value = <0.001), with Salvia multicaulis and S. officinalis having significantly higher targeted chemical richness (19.7 and 19.4, respectively) than S. sclarea and S. aethiopis (15.6 and 16.0, respectively). Targeted chemical composition clearly clustered by species within the nMDS plot (Figure 3B), which was also highly significant (MGLM-ANOVA; Table 3).
